header.title: wxFontData

description.p: This class holds a variety of information related to font dialogs.

desc.p: Constructor.
Initializes fontColour to black, showHelp to false, allowSymbols to true, enableEffects to true, minSize to 0 and maxSize to 0.
Copy Constructor.

func.fsummary: Enables or disables "effects" under Windows or generic only.

desc.p: Enables or disables "effects" under Windows or generic only.
This refers to the controls for manipulating colour, strikeout and underline properties.
The default value is true.

func.fsummary: Under Windows, returns a flag determining whether symbol fonts can be selected.

desc.p: Under Windows, returns a flag determining whether symbol fonts can be selected.
Has no effect on other platforms.
The default value is true.

func.fsummary: Gets the colour associated with the font dialog.

desc.p: Gets the colour associated with the font dialog.
The default value is black.

func.fsummary: Gets the font chosen by the user if the user pressed OK (wxFontDialog::ShowModal() (not implemented in wx) returned wxID_OK).

desc.p: Gets the font chosen by the user if the user pressed OK (wxFontDialog::ShowModal() (not implemented in wx) returned wxID_OK).

func.fsummary: Determines whether "effects" are enabled under Windows.

desc.p: Determines whether "effects" are enabled under Windows.
This refers to the controls for manipulating colour, strikeout and underline properties.
The default value is true.

func.fsummary: Gets the font that will be initially used by the font dialog.

desc.p: Gets the font that will be initially used by the font dialog.
This should have previously been set by the application.

func.fsummary: Returns true if the Help button will be shown (Windows only).

desc.p: Returns true if the Help button will be shown (Windows only).
The default value is false.

func.fsummary: Under Windows, determines whether symbol fonts can be selected.

desc.p: Under Windows, determines whether symbol fonts can be selected.
Has no effect on other platforms.
The default value is true.

func.fsummary: Sets the font that will be returned to the user (for internal use only).

desc.p: Sets the font that will be returned to the user (for internal use only).

func.fsummary: Sets the colour that will be used for the font foreground colour.

desc.p: Sets the colour that will be used for the font foreground colour.
The default colour is black.

func.fsummary: Sets the font that will be initially used by the font dialog.

desc.p: Sets the font that will be initially used by the font dialog.

func.fsummary: Sets the valid range for the font point size (Windows only).

desc.p: Sets the valid range for the font point size (Windows only).
The default is 0, 0 (unrestricted range).

func.fsummary: Determines whether the Help button will be displayed in the font dialog (Windows only).

desc.p: Determines whether the Help button will be displayed in the font dialog (Windows only).
The default value is false.
Destroys the object.
